ams

Class ClassThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • ams.ClassThread

  • public class ClassThread
extends java.lang.Object
    The idea here is to try and have a constant java thread that's consistently checking the time to see verify which class is currently ongoing. The main use I have for this is for the Presence class, the timeCheck() method
    Author:
    Maan Alaulaqi (201610814@aau.ac.ae)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ClassThread() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static int classCheck()
      This method is to check which "time slot" of the day as class is ongoing.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ClassThread

        public ClassThread()

    • Method Detail

      • classCheck

        public static int classCheck()
        This method is to check which "time slot" of the day as class is ongoing. The classCheck() method is written with knowledge of the tables in the database.
        Returns:
        The number returned will be used in SQL queries where we need to obtain the class list of active classes
